# The `X86FlagsCopyLowering.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Lowers COPY nodes of EFLAGS by directly extracting and preserving individual flag bits. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Lowers COPY nodes of EFLAGS by directly extracting and preserving individual flag bits.

We have to do this by carefully analyzing and rewriting the usage of the copied EFLAGS register because there is no general way to rematerialize the entire EFLAGS register safely and efficiently. Using <code>popf</code> both forces dynamic stack adjustment and can create correctness issues due to IF, TF, and other non-status flags being overwritten. Using sequences involving SAHF don&#39;t work on all x86 processors and are often quite slow compared to directly testing a single status preserved in its own GPR.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\file</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Lowers COPY nodes of EFLAGS by directly extracting and preserving individual</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="comment">/// flag bits.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We have to do this by carefully analyzing and rewriting the usage of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="comment">/// copied EFLAGS register because there is no general way to rematerialize the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="comment">/// entire EFLAGS register safely and efficiently. Using &#96;popf&#96; both forces</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="comment">/// dynamic stack adjustment and can create correctness issues due to IF, TF,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and other non-status flags being overwritten. Using sequences involving</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SAHF don&#39;t work on all x86 processors and are often quite slow compared to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="comment">/// directly testing a single status preserved in its own GPR.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Grab the one successor edge that will stay in &#96;MBB&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp;UnsplitSucc = &#42;PrevI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#ad67c9230577a0b640c52852c75c93939">getOperand</a>(0).<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand/#a57e64b633278df75c699e6b98ce15031">getMBB</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Analyze the original block to see if we are actually splitting an edge</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into two edges. This can happen when we have multiple conditional jumps to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the same successor.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsEdgeSplit =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::any&#95;of(SplitI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node-impl/#af719fc783be6589465137d997701a432">getIterator</a>(), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>.instr&#95;end(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">                  &#91;&amp;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">                    assert(MI.isTerminator() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">                           </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Should only have spliced terminators!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal">                    return llvm::any&#95;of(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">                        MI.operands(), &#91;&amp;&#93;(MachineOperand &amp;MOp) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="normal">                          return MOp.isMBB() &amp;&amp; MOp.getMBB() == &amp;UnsplitSucc;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">                        &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">                  &#125;) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We change the code, so we don&#39;t preserve the dominator tree anyway. If we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// got a valid MDT from the pass manager, use that, otherwise construct one</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// now. This is an optimization that avoids unnecessary MDT construction for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %1:gr8 = SETCCr cc, implicit $eflags</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// OP1 implicit-def dead $eflags</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TEST8rr %1, %1, implicit-def $eflags</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// OP2 ne, implicit $eflags</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;CopyI : <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siloweri1copies-cpp/#a5cd9e4c7fe1a7ebe8b545eb891a2a949">Copies</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a> = &#42;CopyI-&gt;getParent();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;CopyDefI = &#42;MRI-&gt;getVRegDef(VOp.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand/#ac0035d7c1c860501c877c20e6e93297b">getReg</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CopyDefI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#a0363204b5fbab08a46f5a7cd7f376f78">getOpcode</a>() != TargetOpcode::COPY) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: The big likely candidate here are PHI nodes. We could in theory</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// handle PHI nodes, but it gets really, really hard. Insanely hard. Hard</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// enough that it is probably better to change every other part of LLVM</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to avoid creating them. The issue is that once we have PHIs we won&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// know which original EFLAGS value we need to capture with our setCCs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// below. The end result will be computing a complete set of setCCs that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we &#42;might&#42; want, computing them in every place where we copy &#42;out&#42; of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// EFLAGS and then doing SSA formation on all of them to insert necessary</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// PHI nodes and consume those here. Then hoping that somehow we DCE the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// unnecessary ones. This DCE seems very unlikely to be successful and so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we will almost certainly end up with a glut of dead setCC</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions. Until we have a motivating test case and fail to avoid</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it by changing other parts of LLVM&#39;s lowering, we refuse to handle</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this complex case here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Walk up across live-in EFLAGS to find where they were actually def&#39;ed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This copy&#39;s def may just be part of a region of blocks covered by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a single def of EFLAGS and we want to find the top of that region where</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// possible.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is essentially a search for a &#42;candidate&#42; reaching definition</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// location. We don&#39;t need to ever find the actual reaching definition here,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// but we want to walk up the dominator tree to find the highest point which</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// would be viable for such a definition.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasEFLAGSClobber = &#91;&amp;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> Begin,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><Highlight kind="normal">                                <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> End) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Scan backwards as we expect these to be relatively short and often find</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61d13d6824ec46c31260a4fd0997eda0">llvm::any&#95;of</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><Highlight kind="normal">          &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#af9745f59d6647bd43f9f7959ca1a9971">isLiveIn</a>(X86::EFLAGS) &amp;&amp; !TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a877507fda31c207ec36a018784369708">pred&#95;empty</a>() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><Highlight kind="normal">           !HasEFLAGSClobber(TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ab2d91e7bec944efcbc39d8e30644f111">begin</a>(), TestPos)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Find the nearest common dominator of the predecessors, as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that will be the best candidate to hoist into.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;HoistMBB =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><Highlight kind="normal">          std::accumulate(std::next(TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ab644fcf07a4c2708333cf66276282357">pred&#95;begin</a>()), TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a0359a738e0412c5a7ea55d61175e0661">pred&#95;end</a>(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><Highlight kind="normal">                          &#42;TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ab644fcf07a4c2708333cf66276282357">pred&#95;begin</a>(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><Highlight kind="normal">                          &#91;&amp;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;LHS, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;RHS) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><Highlight kind="normal">                            return MDT-&gt;findNearestCommonDominator(LHS, RHS);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><Highlight kind="normal">                          &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now we need to scan all predecessors that may be reached along paths to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the hoist block. A clobber anywhere in any of these blocks the hoist.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that this even handles loops because we require &#42;no&#42; clobbers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (HasEFLAGSClobberPath(HoistMBB, TestMBB))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We also need the terminators to not sneakily clobber flags.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (HasEFLAGSClobber(HoistMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a7f0521fa2de44271fd4b909ea7351ef3">getFirstTerminator</a>()-&gt;getIterator(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="normal">                           HoistMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#acae72f6ab1071b7ec87b741a8bef582b">instr&#95;end</a>()))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We found a viable location, hoist our test position to it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><Highlight kind="normal">      TestMBB = HoistMBB;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><Highlight kind="normal">      TestPos = TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a7f0521fa2de44271fd4b909ea7351ef3">getFirstTerminator</a>()-&gt;getIterator();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Clear the debug location as it would just be confusing after hoisting.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><Highlight kind="normal">      TestLoc = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/dwarf-linker/#a463a58e257d5f6fb2c39eb9a2474fc24ac2e06fc138163b7095fa483616a0a47a">DebugLoc</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DefIt = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac78c09ae232b2ce188ff590d51e3c268">llvm::find&#95;if</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="normal">          <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a6b0ac1fa4f05de76413c5e0ca6334035">llvm::reverse</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a341215803e83773a3e97860dc291f121">llvm::make&#95;range</a>(TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a172e7bd9150eb0519ef04c796086f93d">instr&#95;begin</a>(), TestPos)),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal">          &#91;&amp;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="normal">            return MI.findRegisterDefOperand(X86::EFLAGS, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;TRI=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">nullptr);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><Highlight kind="normal">          &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DefIt.base() != TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a172e7bd9150eb0519ef04c796086f93d">instr&#95;begin</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;  Using live-in flags for BB:\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="normal">        TestMBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a8cec41e65c7ebf7da3e9d41f2317065e">dump</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// While rewriting uses, we buffer jumps and rewrite them in a second pass</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// because doing so will perturb the CFG that we are walking to find the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// uses in the first place.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, 4&gt;</a> JmpIs;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Gather the condition flags that have already been preserved in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// registers. We do this from scratch each time as we expect there to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// very few of them and we expect to not revisit the same copy definition</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// many times. If either of those change sufficiently we could build a map</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of these up front instead.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-x86flagscopylowering-cpp-/#ada6d77039c397fec6507365acb38fc1e">CondRegArray</a> CondRegs = collectCondsInRegs(&#42;TestMBB, TestPos);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Collect the basic blocks we need to scan. Typically this will just be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a single basic block but we may have to scan multiple blocks if the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// EFLAGS copy lives into successors.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MachineBasicBlock &#42;, 2&gt;</a> Blocks;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><Highlight kind="normal">    Blocks.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">do</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp;UseMBB = &#42;Blocks.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl/#a0c8ffe664a36e30d49c84d0aded2fe08">pop&#95;back&#95;val</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Track when if/when we find a kill of the flags in this block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FlagsKilled = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In most cases, we walk from the beginning to the end of the block. But</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when the block is the same block as the copy is from, we will visit it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// twice. The first time we start from the copy and go to the end. The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// second time we start from the beginning and go to the copy. This lets</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// us handle copies inside of cycles.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: This loop is &#42;super&#42; confusing. This is at least in part</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a symptom of all of this routine needing to be refactored into</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="559"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// documentable components. Once done, there may be a better way to write</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="560"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="561"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MII = (&amp;UseMBB == &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a> &amp;&amp; !VisitedBlocks.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl/#a1f475b0df44ebd7169e720fa1bf9169e">count</a>(&amp;UseMBB))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="562"><Highlight kind="normal">                          ? std::next(CopyI-&gt;getIterator())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="563"><Highlight kind="normal">                          : UseMBB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a172e7bd9150eb0519ef04c796086f93d">instr&#95;begin</a>(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><Highlight kind="normal">                MIE = UseMBB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#acae72f6ab1071b7ec87b741a8bef582b">instr&#95;end</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><Highlight kind="normal">           MII != MIE;) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a> = &#42;MII++;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we are in the original copy block and encounter either the copy</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// def or the copy itself, break so that we don&#39;t re-process any part of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the block or process the instructions in the range that was copied</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// over.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a> == CopyI || &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a> == &amp;CopyDefI) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><Highlight kind="normal">          <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(&amp;UseMBB == &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a> &amp;&amp; VisitedBlocks.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl/#a1f475b0df44ebd7169e720fa1bf9169e">count</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><Highlight kind="normal">                 </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Should only encounter these on the second pass over the &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><Highlight kind="normal">        &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> &#42;FlagUse =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><Highlight kind="normal">            <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.findRegisterUseOperand(X86::EFLAGS, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;TRI=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><Highlight kind="normal">        FlagsKilled = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.modifiesRegister(X86::EFLAGS, TRI);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!FlagUse)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;  Rewriting use: &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.dump());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check the kill flag before we rewrite as that may change it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (FlagUse-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand/#a4046212ebc647b17e811837ae4ea3afd">isKill</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><Highlight kind="normal">          FlagsKilled = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Once we encounter a branch, the rest of the instructions must also be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// branches. We can&#39;t rewrite in place here, so we handle them below.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that we don&#39;t have to handle tail calls here, even conditional</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// tail calls, as those are not introduced into the X86 MI until post-RA</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// branch folding or black placement. As a consequence, we get to deal</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with the simpler formulation of conditional branches followed by tail</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// calls.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86/#a0f2b2ef8f4560ffd46c7966e8315142f">X86::getCondFromBranch</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>) != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86/#a1a356a51a1fb4cc3c427599082cf1d2eab1840bfcd789713b29a40d9d55cb41e3">X86::COND&#95;INVALID</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> JmpIt = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getIterator();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">do</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><Highlight kind="normal">            JmpIs.push&#95;back(&amp;&#42;JmpIt);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><Highlight kind="normal">            ++JmpIt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><Highlight kind="normal">          &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (JmpIt != UseMBB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#acae72f6ab1071b7ec87b741a8bef582b">instr&#95;end</a>() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, we need to emit a store.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MIB = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a17e04afcf0c5efeb0eb6a9a45287b5e4">BuildMI</a>(&#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getParent(), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getIterator(), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getDebugLoc(),</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Copy the address operands.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
